channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: RFK Jr. selection takes toll on weight-loss-drug makers alongside vaccine stocks
One of the most influential female CEOs in Europe leads a $49 billion company helping others adapt to climate change
item.description: Veolia is headquartered in Paris and handles waste management and de-pollution for states and companies.

item.title: Good news about the U.S. economy is looking like bad news for stocks
U.S. industrial output battered for second month by Boeing strike and hurricanes
Week looks like a loser for U.S. stocks as Dow drops 275 points — live coverage
The world has only deployed 10% of the climate technologies it needs to achieve net zero, new research by McKinsey shows
item.description: 12 challenges are particularly demanding—and 40 to 60% of the CO2 emissions of the energy system cannot be abated unless they are tackled.

item.title: How this architectural engineering firm built sustainability into its business
item.description: Companies can build trust by showing that they take the climate crisis seriously, says CEO of PAE Christian Agulles.

item.title: Trump killing the EV tax credit would hurt Tesla but be catastrophic for Elon Musk’s competition, analysts say
item.description: Musk seems to favor pulling up the ladder that he used to climb the auto industry.

item.title: Health stocks are having their worst week since 2020, and trading volume is high
From biopharma to real estate to shipping, top CEOs insist AI is worth the hype
item.description: Stop being afraid of newfangled technology, and start letting your kids use it to help them with their homework, said panelists at Fortune Global Foru...
